title: Souhardya De
text:
Souhardya De (born 2004) is an Indian writer, columnist, and <a href="podcast">podcast</a>er, from <a href="Midnapore">Midnapore</a>, <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. He is a columnist for the "<a href="The%20Sunday%20Guardian">Sunday Guardian</a>" and a recipient of the <a href="Pradhan%20Mantri%20Rashtriya%20Bal%20Puraskar">Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar</a>, a <a href="List%20of%20civil%20awards%20and%20decorations">civilian award</a> for Indian citizens under the age of 18, in 2021.
Personal life.
De is a high school student at <a href="Vidyasagar%20Shishu%20Niketan">Vidyasagar Shishu Niketan</a> in <a href="Midnapore">Midnapore</a>, <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. His father, Shakti Prasad De is an <a href="assistant%20professor">assistant professor</a> of History at the <a href="Midnapore%20College">Midnapore College</a> and his mother Jayati De is as a teacher at a <a href="State%20school">government school</a>, in <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Career.
He is a columnist for the "Sunday Guardian" and a podcaster, hosting a show called "Cosmographia: The Graeco Romans, the Egyptians and Us".
Bibliography.
De has self-published two books on Indian history and mythology.
